statement.tex: \text{Find an anti-derivative (or integral) of $e^{2x}$}\\ \text{by the method of inspection.}

step.reason: \text{Anti-derivative or integral is the reverse of}\\ \text{differentiation. Therefore, when }\dfrac{d}{dx}f(x)=g(x)\\ \text{then integral of }g(x)=f(x).

step.context: \text{The function below has the derivative}\\ \text{$e ^{nx}$, where }n \in \mathbb{R}
